Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [bouncing on an exercise ball] You should get one of these.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you even know what this is? It is a fitness orb and it has completely changed my life. Forget everything you thought you knew about ab workouts.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Done.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This ab workout is specifically designed to strengthen your core. [knocks things around Jim's desk] Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: S'ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Numerous health benefits, strengthens your back, better performance in sports, more enjoyable sex.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're not having sex.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Plus, improves your reflexes [knocks over more stuff] see, I would have caught that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, you know what, uh, how much is that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's only twenty-five bucks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. Um, ok. [pops Dwight's orb with scissors]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, could I see you in my office?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's performance review day, company-wide. Last year, my performance review started with Michael asking me what my hopes and dreams were, and it ended with him telling me he could bench-press 190 pounds. So, I don't really know what to expect.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, you're trustworthy-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And a woman-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And I want you to listen to a voicemail from my boss. [Jan on recording] "Michael, it's Jan. I guess I missed you. I'll, uh, be there this afternoon for performance reviews. I hope it's understood that that will be our only topic of discussion. See you soon." First impressions?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, just off the top... I think she'll be here this afternoon.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My boss is coming in today, the lovely Jan Levinson-Gould will, well, no Gould. The Gould has been [makes slashing neck hand motion] swack, divorced. Um, the awkward part is that this will be the first time that we'll be seeing each other since, well, uh, it was really nothing. We just sort of got caught up in the moment. The vulnerable divorcee gives herself to the understanding, with rugged good-looks, office manager. Just, uh, she didn't want it to continue for some reason. It, we both, I didn't want it, we both didn't want it to continue. Was not professional. Um, when people say something's mutual, it never is. But this was mutual.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [playing Jan's message] "I guess I missed you." I guess I missed you. So, she misses me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: She missed you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But then she goes on to say "that will be our only topic of discussion". That doesn't mean anything, those are just words.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have one idea of what it means.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. Yeah, what, what?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well I don't think you're gonna be very happy with this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ohhh, great. Well, now I'm in a terrible mood. Let's do your performance review-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because she's conflicted. She has to be professional, but she's fighting feelings... for you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, why, that's great news? That, that, then why would, why would I not like that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, just cause, that, you work together, and it might be awkward.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, wow, wow. Alright, let's listen to that again. [plays Jan's message] "Michael, it's Jan. I guess I missed you".

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, listen, Jim. Here's a little tip for your performance review.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Tell Michael that we should be stocking more of the double-tabbed manila file folders.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We don't have double-tabbed manila file folders.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, yes, we do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, we don't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's a new product. So, you should just suggest that to him and he'll be sure to give you a raise.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright... well, I'm not asking for a raise. I'm gonna actually be asking for a pay decrease.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, that is so stupid. What if he gives it to you?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I win.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ugh, you know what? I am going to zone you out for the rest of today. I need to stay focused, and I don't have to see you tomorrow or Sunday and please don't call me, and we'll see how things go on Monday. Uh, stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait, wait; one thing. Uh, by tomorrow, you mean Saturday, right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, duh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Duh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Today is Thursday. But Dwight thinks that it's Friday. And that's what I'll be working on this afternoon.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Sometimes women say more in their pauses than they say in their words.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, yes. Let's listen to it again. And this time, really listen to the pauses.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: God, Stanley, that's frickin' brilliant. How do you know that? Did you learn that on the streets? Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, no, that's ok. I did learn it on the streets. On the ghetto, in fact.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No kidding.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: It's all about my bonus.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael and Jan definitely made out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ohh...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe more.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Eck!... Oh! Also, it is Thursday, but Dwight thinks it's Friday. So, keep that goin'.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, yea!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good work, Stanley. Great performance review. Stanley in the house, everybody. Woo! Angela, your turn.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I actually look forward to performance reviews. I did the youth beauty pageant circuit. And I enjoyed that quite a bit. I really enjoy being judged. I believe I hold up very well to even severe scrutiny.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jan's on the phone for you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh; Angela, you were totally satisfactory this year.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Interesting. Jan is calling me. Maybe it wasn't so mutual after all. [puts Jan on speakerphone] Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jan! To what do I owe this pleasure?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I am returning your many calls.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, hello to you, too. Um, yeah, I was just um, I just wanted to get some closure on uh, what transpired between us at the meeting we had in the parking lot of the Chili's.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No. No, we won't be discussing that, Michael. The only things I wanna talk about during your performance review are your concrete ideas to improve your branch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, surely this uh, review is a formality because of what happened uh, at our meeting in the parking lot of Chili's.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Uh, your review is anything but a formality, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I expect you to forget anything that you think may have happened between us and exhibit completely professional behavior.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Been thinking about you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Ok, that is an example of completely unprofessional behavior.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, I don't see how that's unprofessional. Just-

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Are the cameras with you...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: ...in your office?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They are not. Yes, they are. [Jan hangs up] That's my girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I heard they made out and had sex.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No, they just made out. That's it.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, I heard they made out and had sex.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Don't talk about it. Office romances are nobody's business but the people involved.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Romances?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, I have ideas on a daily basis. I know I do. I have a clear memory of telling people my ideas. Um, is there any chance you wrote any of my ideas down? In a folder? A "Michael-idea" folder?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's unfortunate. How 'bout the suggestion box? There's tons of ideas in there.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What suggestion box?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The suggestion box that I put out, and people could be put in suggestions anonymously? Maybe there's prizes?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. Uh, I think I remember that from back from when I first started.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why don't you find it and tell people to get theirs... never mind, I'll tell them. Hello, everybody? Yeah, uh, attention, please. Jan Levinson's coming, very soon, and so, we're going to have our weekly suggestion box meeting, so you can all get your constructive compliments in a.s.a.p.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Don't you mean constructive criticism?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What did I say?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You said "constructive complements"; that doesn't make any sense.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, Kelly, that was neither constructive nor a compliment, so maybe you should stop criticizing my English and start making some suggestions. 'K?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hey, Dan, this is Jim, and it is about 11:15, and I wanted to know what you were up to tomorrow, which is the fifteenth, and that is a...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Saturday.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [pumps fist] ...Saturday, so just let me know what you're doing tomorrow, Saturday, for lunch. Ok, talk to you soon.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on phone] We'll address this in the meeting then. Ok. Ok, bye-bye. [to Pam] Could you please tell Michael that I'm here?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi, Jan. How are you?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm good; how are you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Nice to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. [tries to kiss Jan's hand] Ok, why don't we just step into my office? We're gonna go in here.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Can we please go in your office?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep, right after you. Apres-vous. [mouths to Pam] No calls.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oooo.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright [takes Jan's coat].

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's nice to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Nice to see you too, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Not like that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, well.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You know Michael, I think I need to make something clear right off the top. I'm not going to discuss anything with you other than Dunder-Mifflin business.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Period.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Do we understand each other.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm a little confused. 'Cause first it's all like kissy-kissy. And then it's like all regret. Because "Oh, I regret that." But, "Wait, I'm still gonna call you." But, but, "We're just gonna talk business. And I may come down and fire you if you don't do your job." But what were talking about when we first kissed? Business.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So are you still in the middle of the performance reviews then?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, I finished all of that. I'm very fast. I'm not too fast. Not like wham-bam-thank ya ma'am. But I do say thank ya ma'am. But, I'm, I'm not like wham-bam. Not that there's anything wrong with wham-bam. If it's consensual. [cold Jan stare] We're talking about office stuff. Can I ask you a question?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is a business question. It's nothing personal, I promise.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Fine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you wearing a new perfume today?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: How is that a business question?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you're wearing it at the office. And [smells Jan] it, I'm sorry, but no offense, but it's really sexy.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Please don't smell me, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, how's it goin'?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my God, did you see "The Apprentice" last night?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Course, it's on every Thursday night, so how could I miss it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Can you believe who Trump fired?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, that was unbelievable.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who? Who was it? Who did he fire?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You didn't see it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, I went out and got drunk with my laser tag team last night. Crap! I never go out on a Thursday night; what the hell was I thinking?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't understand- [phone rings] Hold on. Sorry. [answers] Yes, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, it's time for the suggestion box meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm kind of in the middle of something. I wish you wouldn't interrupt.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You told me to buzz you about the suggestion box meeting when Jan was here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I did not, not, not use those words.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Uh, I'd like to sit in on that meeting [to Pam] is it happening right now?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it's in like ten minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Everyone's waiting in the conference room.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Great. Very good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why are we here? Because I value your opinions. Now, I know a lot of don't think that I read your suggestions, but I do. I just sift through them every week and I really look and scrutinize to see what you guys are writing. Um, so, let's, uh, just read some of these suckers. Alright. Number one:

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I can't, I can't-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't understand why you're so upset.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Please sit down.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let me ask you-

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You're gonna sit here and I'm gonna go sit over there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, let me ask you this.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Please, sit yourself down.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let me ask you something.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Where did you get your outfit?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [loud metal music playing in a stairwell; Dwight pacing] You are giving me this raise! I deserve this raise! [plays air guitar] Yes! [kicks] Yes! Yes! Hiya! The least you can do is keep my salary consistent with inflation! Keeya eyah! Yes! Why are you gonna give me this raise? Why? Because... I'm awesome! I am awesome!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I just don't understand why you have to pretend like nothing happened.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Because nothing did, Michael. It, I'm not going to say anything more about it, and I would advise that you do the same

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh my God...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, am I interrupting? Oh God; were you guys making out?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No, Dwight; come in.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What do you want Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am ready for my performance review.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, great. Your performance has been adequate. You may leave; goodbye.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Is this how you've been conducting all the reviews, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You wanna talk now, good; OK, Dwight, leave.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, wait, I would like to discuss my raise?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why on earth would we give you a raise?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is an excellent question. Thank you for asking. Let me bring up one word:

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Look, I know it's your job, I know you have to ask, but I promise you, I'm not gonna discuss it with him, I'm certainly not gonna discuss it with you. [digs a cigarette out of her purse] Do you have a light?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And in conclusion, I think that Lex Luthor said it best when he said "Dad, you have no idea what I'm capable of".

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's from Superman?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Smallville. And that is why, I feel, that I deserve this raise.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you think Michael and Jan actually...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't really wanna picture it. But thank you, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How do you come back from that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, you don't, I don't think, come all the way back, you know. Especially working together.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I mean doing that with Michael. How do you come back from that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: As a human being.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, no, I don't think you can.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm heading back to New York; Alan and I will conduct your performance review over the phone tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait, wait, wait, come, I just, I just wanna know why?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael, now is not the time or the place.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, so you're saying that there is a different time or place?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No, I am saying we are never having this conversation.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, ok, well never as in 'never ever ever', or never as in there's still a chance?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Never, for me, always means 'never ever ever.'

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I just want to know, from the horse's mouth, what is the dealio?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael, it has nothing-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Am I too short?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: With your looks, ok? It's your personality. I mean, you're obnoxious, and rude, and, and, and stupid, and you do have coffee breath, by the way, and, and I don't agree about the b.o., but you are very, very inconsiderate.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Really. You're, you're, you're a great guy, ok?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I appreciate that, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: And you were very sweet, and you stayed up with me and talked with me, cried with me, and I appreciate that-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I wasn't, I didn't cry-

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: At this time in my life. I just am not in the place right now where I'm looking for a relationship, so we can still work together, we can still be friends but... ok?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So my looks have nothing to do with it?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Ohhh, God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jan is not in a place where she feels she can have a relationship right now. And it doesn't matter how great a guy I am. And that is all I needed; I'm good. I can go home now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, it's 12:20; where the hell's Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ummm... no idea.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Never missed a day, my ass.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Jim bows to Pam; she bows back] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [running through parking lot] I'm here! I'm here! I'm here! It's ok!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oscar, I'm ready for you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Today is performance-review day, company-wide, and I'm a little concerned about my review. I exceeded my sick days and my personal days because I just couldn't take it. And I don't have a good answer for him, when he asks me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, I don't know what to say.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, you're in accounting...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes, I'm in accounting and I'm sorry and all the extra days. I know I passed my limit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, good, good, good. Something to work toward, being here more. I'm a big believer in people being here more.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what this is?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, you don't.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Then why the question?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is a visual aid for my performance review. Budget is tight, and if anyone is getting a raise, it is gonna be a fight to the death. And I intend on winning that fight. "Dwight: determined, worker, intense, good worker, hard worker, terrific. Dwight."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I have one, too. Jim. Jim, Is Jim. My name is Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's a total waste of your "M."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You have a better idea?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, magnificent worker, marvelous worker, more money for this worker. Man, I like this worker. Mighty worker. That's good. That's good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'll use that.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I am not going to discuss anything with you other than Dunder Mifflin business.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Period.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Do we understand each other?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: "I am not going to discuss anything outside of Dunder Mifflin business, period." Okay. Now, why would Jan say she only wants to talk business and then make it clear that she is on her period? God, I don't understand women. How about a clear signal, right? Is that too much to ask?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, that's... It's great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, it is.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. You have fun?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I did.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did you go to first base?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hell, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did you go to second?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Second.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kind of, yeah. Over the shirt, my elbow, but...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, so close call at second. Was there an infield fly?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, yup, wait, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pop-up?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, there... Later there was.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, you got the signal from the third-base coach. You know what I'm saying? Like if there was a fly out to deep right, you know. A runner on second. He tagged up, didn't he?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I didn't, you know, it was... It was dark, for one thing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Office romances. Um... [laughs] I think you should probably ask Pam 'cause she's in an office romance, technically.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's just push on, shall we?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pushing on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's next. Just keep it. "Look on the supply shelf." What? What is that? All right, Ryan, look on the supply shelf, would you?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah. It's another note.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: "Look on the windshield."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Does it specify which windshield?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'll check them all.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This ought to be good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Which one?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no. It's on the Miata.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He sees it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What does it say?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He can't hear you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, field trip's over. Come on. Could we please get back to this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [clapping] Come on. Let's get back to this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, don't break any lands-speed records getting back, okay, Stanley?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Christ Almighty.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: "Look under the sink in the men's room."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, next suggestion.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Next suggestion.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: "Don't..." Okay, that's blank. Don't. Just...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: "Don't sleep with your boss." Do you think this is referring to you boning Jan?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Okay, let me make something clear. As embarrassing as this is, I feel that it needs to be said. There is nothing romantic or sexual going on with Michael and myself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: The other night, I gave him a polite congratulatory kiss because he just closed the biggest deal of his career. And that's it. If anything else has been implied, Dwight, or inferred, Michael, Creed, it's just not true, okay? It's not true. So... Is everyone straight on that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Crystal.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There's one more suggestion.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How pleasant. You can...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: "Way to go man, Jan's really hot."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, I think we're good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. When Dwight said no one wants to come in on a Saturday...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I almost lost it. That was too good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, that is because that is the gift that keeps on giving. Oh, my God. I left today's paper on my desk.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You mean yesterday's paper.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What? Yes, that is exactly what I mean. Wow. You are very good at what you do.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, temp.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look, we're twins.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Bet you I got mine for less than yours.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I bet you did.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Getting a little something that calm the nerves?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What nerves?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: For the performance review. Oh, wait, you don't get one. You're a temp.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Actually, I had mine already.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're lying.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Why would I lie about a performance review?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why would Michael give you one before me?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I think because my name is before yours in alphabetical order. [coins dropping]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How did it go?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Fine. He actually gave me a small raise, which I did not ask for. [hits vending machine] It's stuck. [Dwight begins throwing his entire body into the vending machine] It's cool, it fell.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Wild Side playing] You are gonna give me this raise. Ya! Yes, you are. You are gonna give me this raise. Ya! Ya! The least you can do is keep my salary consistent with inflation, right? You are gonna give me this raise! Why? Because I'm awesome, awesome, yes! Yes! Yes! Thank you for your time, dude. Champ. My lord, mi amigo. Mi amor. Ha! Wild side! I am ready. [groans]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, that got a little out of control. Jan's taking a break, which is fine. I'm doing the same, just chilling. Getting my mind off of us. She's right. I need to be more professional at the office. When I'm at work, I need to focus on work. I should call her ex-husband.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello, is this R. Gould? Hi there. My name is Michael Scott, I work at Dunder Mifflin. I believe I work with your wife, ex-wife, Jan. Yeah, that's right, yes. Um... I was wondering if I could ask a personal question about her. Mmm-hmm. Okay, well, could I ask anyway? Uh-huh. Well, I'm just gonna ask. When you guys were dating was she sort of easy to get and then really hard to get?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, that Gould is a real interesting guy, a gem. I can see why he and Jan are no longer together. If my conversation with him is any measure of their relationship, he was verbally abusive, he was curt. He was... He had an inability to communicate, shall I say? He was emotionally unavailable. I don't know how she dealt with that as long as she did.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Never...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Never for me always means never, ever, ever.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, then, Gould wasn't kidding.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nothing, I just...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What did you say, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Did you call my ex?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I did not.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Gould, you said, Gould.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe I did. Maybe I called him, I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: How dare you, Michael? My personal life is off-limits to you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Okay, how dare you do that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I didn't do that. I... Maybe he called me.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Why would he do that? Why would he call you, Michael? Why would my husband call you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ex-husband, you have to let it go.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I mean...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: "Look under the suggestion box." "I can't believe I kept this up all day." Signed, me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is an office? Is it a group of people? Maybe. Is it an idea? Of course, yes. Is it a living organism? Exactly, yes. And any single cell organism has to have a spine, and that's me. But the spine is always controlled by a brain, and that is Jan. But the brain needs a heart, and that is me again. So ironic. You know what? The heart is smarter than the brain. But the brain is so effing hot.
